meanings.definition: A sail set forward of the foremast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The headsail caught the wind and propelled the boat forward.
meanings.sent2: The sailors raised the headsail to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the headsail, thinking it was a perch.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the headsail glowed like a golden wing against the darkening sky.
meanings.sent5: The headsail billowed out like a giant lung, filling with the breath of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The sail set on the headstay of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: Securing the headsail to the headstay was crucial for smooth sailing.
meanings.sent2: The headsail fluttered in the wind as the ship changed course.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull mistook the headsail for a giant swing and perched on it.
meanings.sent4: The headsail cut through the air like a sharp blade, slicing the wind effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The headsail danced in the breeze, a graceful partner to the rhythm of the waves.
